node_2: list of accolades received by devdas (2002 hindi film)
edge: Devdas was the Indian submission for the Best International Feature Film at the 75th Academy Awards. This list details the accolades that the movie has received.

node_2: main article: list of accolades received by devdas (2002 hindi film)
edge: The main article provides more information about the list of accolades that the movie has received.
Devdas was the Indian submission for the Best International Feature Film at the 75th Academy Awards.
The FFI chose Devdas over several other films to be submitted for the Best International Feature Film at the 75th Academy Awards.
Bhansali asked Khan and Gowariker for their help to get Devdas submitted for the Best International Feature Film at the Academy Awards.
Bhaskaran, a journalist from The Hindu, criticized the FFI's decision to not submit Devdas for the Academy Awards.

node_2: 56th iteration of the british academy film awards (bafta)
edge: Devdas received a nomination for the Best Film Not in the English Language at the 56th iteration of the BAFTAs.
Devdas received five awards at the 50th National Film Awards, including Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment and Best Playback Singer - Female (Ghoshal).

node_1: best popular film providing wholesome entertainment
edge: The movie '...' received the award for Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment at a prestigious ceremony.
In addition to winning the Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment award, the movie '...' also won the award for Best Playback Singer – Female (performed by Ghoshal) at the same ceremony.
The movie '...' won the award for Best Production Design, courtesy Desai, at a reputed awards ceremony.

node_1: best costume design (lulla, jani, khosla, shariffi)
edge: The movie '...' also bagged the award for Best Costume Design, thanks to the efforts of Lulla, Jani, Khosla, and Shariffi at a notable event.
The movie '...' was also honoured with the award for Best Choreography, thanks to Saroj Khan's creative efforts.
The movie '...' bagged a total of 11 awards, the most for any film at that time, at the 48th Filmfare Awards.
The movie '...' won a total of 16 out of its 18 nominations at the 4th IIFA Awards, including the Best Film and Best Director awards.
At the same prestigious event where it won the Best Popular Film Providing Wholesome Entertainment award, the movie '...' also bagged the Best Film award.
The director of the movie '...', Bhansali, was honoured with the prestigious Best Director award at the same ceremony where the movie won several other accolades.
The lead actor of the movie '...', Khan, was awarded the Best Actor award at a reputed event where the movie won several other accolades.
The lead actress of the movie '...', Rai, was awarded the Best Actress award at a reputed event where the movie won several other accolades.
The supporting actress of the movie '...', Kher, was awarded the Best Supporting Actress award at a reputed event where the movie won several other accolades.
